alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 07 at 10:58PM PDT until May 09 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT PDT SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 2 AM PDT Sunday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 4 PM Sunday to midnight PDT Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
